Dear Ms. Melendrez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
1

rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth B was touched inappropriately by Youth A and staff did not
respond appropriately.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 08/15/2023 and no
additional information was provided.
Youth A was interviewed on 08/15/2023 during an unannounced
face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth A stated he was with the
group when they went to a beach outing recently. He initially
stated he was not sure which staff were working that day, but then
remembered Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth A stated Youth B
accused him of touching her inappropriately while at the beach.
He stated he was confused by this and never touched her. Youth
A stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were present and witnessed Youth B
stating this. He believed Staff 1 and Staff 2 “kind of” did not
believe him. He recalled Staff 1 telling him to stay away from
Youth B the rest of the day as well as similar instructions once the
youth returned to the program. Youth A stated Youth B was no
longer placed at the facility so it’s not a problem anymore.
DHHS Foster Care worker 1 was interviewed over a video
conference on 08/18/2023. She stated she had recently visited
Youth A at the facility and Youth A had stated he did in fact touch
Youth B but had lied about it previously to staff.
Youth B was interviewed on 08/28/2023 over the phone. She
confirmed she is now at a new placement. Youth B stated while at
the old placement, she was at a beach with the unit and was
swimming. Youth B stated Youth A touched her under the water in
her private area. She stated this happened maybe 10 feet out
from the beach. She also recalled Youth A asked her to kiss him.
Youth B recalled Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were at the beach.
She stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were sitting at a table near the
water and were able to see the incident. Youth B recalled Youth C
witnessed this and swam back to tell the staff. Youth B stated
Staff 1 noticed what had occurred and started addressing it right
away. Youth B stated Staff 1 had asked Youth A to stay away
from her for the rest of the day, and she did not recall there being
any issue with this instruction. She also stated upon return to the
unit from the beach outing, she talked with Staff 4 and
Administrator 1. She stated Administrator 1 would not listen to her
and Administrator 1 said “no, no, go away, I don’t want to hear it.”
Youth B believed Staff 4 was handling the situation well because
2

Staff 4 was advocating for Youth B’s needs after being touched
inappropriately. Youth B denied ever saying she stated she was
going to allege Youth A touched her.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone on 08/29/2023. Staff 4
recalled the incident where Youth A allegedly touched Youth B on
an outing to the beach. She stated she was not working the day of
the incident but was involved afterwards. Staff 4 recalled talking to
Administrator 1 about the situation. Staff 4 recalled Administrator 1
telling her not to complete an “accusation form” because
Administrator 1 had heard Youth A tell Youth B that he would
accuse her of bad things if she did not play with him. Staff 4 stated
she spoke with Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 1 and Staff 2 said they did
not hear the same thing come from Youth A prior to the incident.
Staff 4 recalled Administrator 1 telling her to “leave it alone, don’t
worry about it” and Administrator 1 would take care of it.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/12/2023. He recalled the incident
where Youth A had allegedly touched Youth B during a beach
outing a few weeks earlier. Staff 1 recalled Youth A and Youth B
struggling to get along before they even went to the beach that
day. He recalled hearing Youth B say “I’m going to say that he
touched me if he doesn’t leave me alone” before they even left.
Staff 1 stated he was walking back from the snack stand when he
heard Youth B state Youth A touched her. He recalled asking her
if something actually happened and she said “no”. As a
precaution, Staff 1 stated he and Staff 2 ensured Youth A stayed
away from Youth B for the rest of the outing and the safety plan
extended to the rest of their time placed together before Youth B
moved. Staff 1 recalled Youth A denied this accusation in the
moment. Staff 1 reported the incident to Administrator 1 upon his
return and wrote an incident report.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 09/12/2023. He recalled Youth B said
she was upset at Youth A as they left the home to go to the beach
outing. He recalled hearing Youth B state “if he doesn’t leave me
alone, I’m gonna say he touched me” while in the water with Youth
A no more than 10 or 15 feet away from where he and Staff 1 had
been located. Staff 2 stated he and Staff 1 advised both of the
youth to stay away from each other in that moment. Staff 2
recalled talking to Administrator 1 once they returned to the facility
and he wrote an incident report.
Youth C was interviewed on 09/12/2023 during an announced
face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated she recalled the
incident where Youth A touched Youth B during a beach outing.
3

She stated she was standing right where the water came up to the
beach and was talking to Staff 1 when she saw Youth A and
Youth B both go under the water just a few feet away. She
believed Youth A put his hand out and touched Youth B in the
crotch area. Youth C stated she told Staff 1 immediately what she
saw. Youth C recalled Youth B standing up and stating Youth A
was making her feel uncomfortable and he touched her. Youth C
recalled Youth A denying this at that moment. Youth C clarified
she did not think she told any of the staff present directly what she
saw but was a side part of the conversation. Youth C recalled
seeing Staff 1 and Staff 2 talk to Youth A and Youth B individually
immediately afterwards. She also recalled hearing Youth A and
Youth B are not supposed to be near each other once they came
back to the unit.
Administrator 1 was interviewed over a video call and
09/13/2023. Administrator 1 recalled talking to everyone that was
allegedly involved in the incident at the beach and “in her opinion”
Youth B‘s recollection of what occurred involved too much
inconsistency. Administrator 1 stated Staff 1 informed her Youth B
had been stating prior to this happening she was going to allege
Youth A touched her if he did not leave her alone. Administrator 1
recalled instructing Staff 1 and Staff 2 to write incident reports
about what had occurred and putting in a safety plan to ensure
Youth A and Youth B weren’t alone together and were not near
each other as best as possible. Administrator 1 stated having a
conversation with DHHS Foster Care worker 1 a couple weeks
later. Administrator 1 was not sure if the caseworker DHHS Foster
Care worker 1 said Youth A admitted touching Youth B after
DHHS Foster Care worker 1’s conversation with Youth A.
Administrator 1 stated staff did not witness any touching between
Youth A and Youth B and there was legitimate concern Youth B
had been stating prior to the incident that she was going to allege
Youth A touched her. Administrator 1 recalled the incident never
came up again after that day. Administrator 1 denied ever stating
anything to Youth B or Staff 4 to the effect that she did not have
time or was not worried about the incident where Youth A
allegedly touched Youth B at the beach. Administrator 1 stated
she never told Youth B she “did not have any time” to speak about
the incident and did not recall ever discussing the incident with
Staff 4 because Staff 4 was not present that day.
Documents reviewed:
• An incident report dated 08/02/2023 authored by Staff 2
was provided and reviewed. In this incident report it was
described that “While at the lake, staff were watching Youth
4

B and her peer playing. When Youth B got upset with her
peer and stated she was going to get him in trouble and
say he was "being inappropriate" with her. Staff observed
no inappropriate interactions but asked them to remain
separated the remainder of the day due to Youth B's
threats.” In addition, actions taken were described as
“Youth B was advised to stay 10 feet away from her peer at
all times, and that if she continues to feel upset, staff will
work with her on practicing coping skills. Youth B later told
staff that her peer had done nothing inappropriate with her
but she wanted him in trouble.”
Analysis Through interviews of youth and staff and documentation
reviewed there was no evidence found Youth A and Youth B were
not being supervised while at the beach nor did staff fail to
respond. Additionally, once staff were notified, they immediately
separated the youth and put a plan in place to keep the youth
separated. There was not sufficient evidence found to show that
any staff failed to respond to the alleged incident in an appropriate
manner after the fact.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157 Behavior management.
Section (2) At a minimum, the behavior management system shall
Description include all of the following:
(b) Positive intervention strategies to assist residents in
developing improved problem solving, self-management,
and social skills.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff members have not used positive language or methods to
respond to behaviors of youth.
Investigation Incident 1
Youth B was interviewed on 08/28/2023 over the phone. Youth B
recalled an incident where she was escalated outside the building
as nighttime began to fall. She stated Staff 5 and Administrator 1
were involved and said there was a “monster in the woods” in
order to try to get her to come back inside. Youth B stated she
was very scared at the moment. She recalled Administrator 1
saying “if you don’t come inside, the man with a machete might be
out there and might get you.” Youth B referenced a news story
that aired the same day of a man in the surrounding area that had
attempted to murder homeless people with the use of a machete.
Youth B recalled wanting to talk to Staff 4 who was inside the
building, and Administrator 1 told Staff 4 to stay inside.
5

Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone on 08/29/2023. Staff 4
recalled Youth B struggled to sleep and was afraid of someone
attacking her in the night. Staff 4 attributed this to an incident
where Youth B was escalated at nighttime outside. Staff 4 recalled
Youth B telling her “They told me someone is going to come get
me”. Staff 4 recalled hearing either Administrator 1 or Staff 5
bringing up a murder suspect that was being sought by the police
and saying something to the effect of “if you don’t come in, we
don’t know if that man is out in those woods” to Youth B. Staff 4
recalled telling Youth B from inside “You’re OK, just calm down
and you will be able to come inside.” Staff 4 stated that she did
not go outside during the incident because she was providing
supervision of Youth C inside and Administrator 1 had told her to
stay inside, even though Youth B was asking for her. Staff 4
stated when Youth B did calm down and come inside, she came
straight to Staff 4 and was very upset that the murder suspect may
have been outside of the facility. Staff 4 recalled Youth B stating,
“they told me there’s a man out in the woods and he’s trying to get
me.” Staff 4 recalled talking to Administrator 1 about the incident
after it had concluded and Administrator 1 telling her “We told her
there were people in the woods so she wouldn’t run away.”
Staff 5 was interviewed on 09/12/2023 during an announced on-
site visit to the facility. She recalled the incident where Youth B
was escalated, and she and Administrator 1 were trying to help
her de-escalate and come back inside. Staff 5 stated this
happened around bedtime. Staff 5 stated she and Administrator 1
stayed between the house and the small parking lot to the facility.
They tried to keep line of sight and communicate with Youth B, but
not approach her because she had started to hit and kick them
when they were near her. She recalled Youth B banging on the
windows around the house during this as well. Staff 5 stated
Youth B wanted to talk to Staff 4 and was yelling for her. Staff 5's
recollection was Staff 4 needed to stay inside because she had
been providing line of sight supervision for Youth C at that time.
Staff 5 recalled she and Administrator 1 tried to go hands on when
Youth B was near them and hitting them but not being successful
in doing so because Youth B would fall to the ground and then run
away from them. Staff 5 recalled telling Youth B “when you stop
hitting us, we will be able to go inside.” Staff 5 stated there was a
rustling heard in the nearby woods just past the property line of
the facility and recalled Youth B asking what it was. Staff 5 stated
she told Youth B she could not see where it was and that it could
have been animals, or it could’ve been that person that had been
in the news involving an attempted murder. She stated it was not
safe outside when you can’t see because it is getting too dark.
6

Staff 5 stated Youth B was still escalated after this part of the
incident, but she eventually was able to calm down and come
inside. Staff 5 recalled Administrator 1 wrote up the incident report
for this incident. Staff 5 even clarified she thought the topic of an
alleged murder being sought by police in the same city as the
facility had come up in the building prior to this incident so Youth A
may have already known about it but could not remember
distinctly how. She stated youth may have overheard staff talking
about as there was a conversation earlier in the day about going
to the park, but staff decided not to because that individual had
not been caught.
Youth C was interviewed on 09/12/2023 during an announced
face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth C recalled the incident.
Youth B was escalated and outside. She stated she heard about
something in the news about a murder suspect being stopped by
police in the city earlier in the day at an outside support group
from the facility. Youth C stated she was inside but heard Staff 5
and Administrator 1 say to Youth B “there’s homeless men in the
woods” and “Yeah, they will come and get you” while Staff 5 and
Administrator 1 were outside with Youth B.
Administrator 1 was interviewed over a video call and
09/13/2023. Administrator 1 recalled the incident. Administrator 1
recalled the incident lasted a very long time and it was difficult to
reason with Youth B or understand exactly why she was upset or
what could help her in the moment. Administrator 1 recalled it
began inside the building, and Youth B ran out and as
Administrator 1 and Staff 5 followed her. They offered to take her
back inside. Administrator 1 recalled Youth B yelling at her and
Staff 5 about not getting enough attention and Youth B was
wanting Staff 4. Administrator 1 recalled Youth B was walking
around the house and finding rocks to throw at windows.
Administrator 1 recalled Youth B yelling for Staff 4 and stating
“Help me because I don’t feel safe with them” referring to
Administrator 1 and Staff 5. Administrator 1 recalled a confusing
dynamic with Youth B in that moment because Youth B would
approach them or ask them to approach her and then, as soon as
they were within a couple feet of her, Youth B would attempt to hit
and kick Administrator 1 and Staff 5. Administrator 1 recalled
Youth B got in the vestibule of the building but threw punches at
her and Staff 5 and ran back outside. Administrator 1 stated she
and Staff 5 attempted to restrain Youth B but they were never
successful because Youth B would slip out of their grip or drop to
her knees. Administrator 1 recalled Youth B asking something to
the effect of “What is out there?” referring to the woods just past
7

the parking lot of the facility. Administrator 1 recalled stating “I
don’t know what’s out there, why don’t we go inside?” in response.
Administrator 1 believed this line of questioning may have
reminded Youth B of the news story about a possible murder
suspect not being caught by police. She stated she did not know if
she or Staff 5 said anything about this new story specifically to
Youth B at the moment. Administrator 1 stated she was trying very
hard to reason with Youth B but was having difficulty because
Youth B wanted Staff 4 to be with her but did not want to go inside
to see Staff 4.
Documents reviewed:
• An incident reported dated 08/01/2023 authored by
Administrator 1 was provided and reviewed. Details were
included in this documentation consistent with Staff 5 and
Administrator 1’s interviews, including Youth B’s escalated
behaviors outside the building. In the incident report it was
written that “Youth B then walked around the parking lot
and the field, crying and claiming to hear someone in the
woods. After some encouragement from staff, Youth B said
she was ready to go to bed.”
Incident 2
Youth A was interviewed on 08/15/2023 during an unannounced
face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth A stated he uses
inappropriate language at times and staff always “catch him” and
redirect him to try to use more appropriate language. He stated
this is difficult because that’s what his brain wants him to say.
Administrator 1 was interviewed over a video call and
09/15/2023. She confirmed Youth A uses very sexually
inappropriate and suggestive language on a consistent basis and
responding to Youth A’s inappropriate language is normal for staff.
She stated this is something that has normal repercussions and
responses from staff. Examples were provided of privileges being
taken away such as screen or tablet time in response to repeated
uses of inappropriate language. In addition, Administrator 1
stated this topic was a commonly communicated with Youth A’s
therapist.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Behavior Management” dated
11/09/2022 was provided and reviewed. In this policy it
was noted a wide range of interventions for staff to use in
8

individual programming for managing behavior, including
redirection and modeling as described by staff interviews.
Analysis Through interviews of youth and staff and documentation
reviewed there was sufficient evidence found to show a violation
of the rule because of the language and methods used by staff in
response to escalated behaviors of Youth B described in Incident
1.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
